data.name: IfThisOptionIsEnabledTheRiderLinkEditor_Text
data.value: If this option is enabled, the RiderLink editor plugin will be automatically updated.

data.name: InstallRiderLinkPluginInEngineDescription_Text
data.value: Install RiderLink plugin into the Engine.

data.name: InstallRiderLinkPluginInGameDescription_Text
data.value: Install RiderLink plugin into every Game available in the Solution. If Rider will fail to install RiderLink plugin to any of the Game projects, It'll revert the installation process.

data.name: ExtractRiderLinkPluginInEngineDescription_Text
data.value: Extract RiderLink plugin into the Engine in the Solution. Note: Use it for Unreal Engine version built from source only. It will not work with UE4 and UE5 from Epic Games Launcher. Use this option if installation of RiderLink plugin fails for some reason.

data.name: ExtractRiderLinkPluginInGameDescription_Text
data.value: Extract RiderLink plugin into every Game available in the Solution. Note: It will not try to build RiderLink for your current project. Use this option if installation of RiderLink plugin fails for some reason.

data.name: UnrealEngine_Version_IsRequired_Message
data.value: <html>UnrealLink supports Unreal Engine versions starting with {0}</html>

data.name: FailedToPatchRiderLinkUplugin_Message
data.value: Failed to set `EnableByDefault` to true in RiderLink.uplugin You need to manually enable RiderLink in UnrealEditor

data.name: FailedToBuildRiderLinkPluginFor__Text
data.value: Failed to build RiderLink plugin for {0}

data.name: Reason_UatIsNotAvailable_Text
data.value: Reason: {0} is not available at expected destination: {1}

data.name: RefreshingProjectsFilesHasBeenCancelled_Text
data.value: Refreshing projects files has been cancelled

data.name: RiderLinkPluginWillNotBeVisibleInThe_Text
data.value: RiderLink plugin will not be visible in the solution explorer

data.name: NeedToRefreshProjectFilesManually_Text
data.value: Need to refresh project files in the Unreal Editor or in the File Explorer with a context action for .uproject file 'Generate project files'

data.name: IntermediateBuildFolderRoot_Text
data.value: Intermediate folder to build RiderLink, before installing into the project

data.name: IntermediateBuildFolder_FileChooserOption_Tooltip
data.value: Path to intermediate folder to build RiderLink, before installing into the project

data.name: BuildingRiderLinkMightFailWithNonASCIISymbols_Text
data.value: Building RiderLink might fail if the path contains non-ASCII symbols. If you have issues with building RiderLink that shows '???' symbols in the build Output window, try setting this variable to a folder without special characters (e.g. C:\temp_folder), but make sure that current user has write access to this folder

data.name: DefaultBehaviorForRiderLinkUpdate_Text
data.value: Default behavior for auto-updating RiderLink plugin

data.name: BuildAndInstall_RadioButton_Text
data.value: Build and install the RiderLink plugin

data.name: ExtractOnly_RadioButton_Text
data.value: Extract the source code, don't build the RiderLink plugin

data.name: InstallOrExtractRadio_Comment_Text
data.value: Note: if the plugin is placed in the Engine project and the Engine is pre-built (e.g. installed from the Epic Games Launcher), it will always Install RiderLink, instead of extracting

data.name: AutoupdateRiderLink_CheckBox_Text
data.value: Automatically update RiderLink plugin for Unreal Editor
